alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 10:46AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The San Lorenzo River at Big Trees gauge reported 13.82 feet at 10:00 AM PDT and is rapidly rising. The San Lorenzo River may require a flood warning if rises continue at this rate. Rainfall will continue through the afternoon. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The San Lorenzo River at Big Trees and surrounding areas. * WHEN...Until 445 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Cruz and Felton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
